channel.title: What to do >.<
channel.description:
Well my parents piss me off so they sold my xbox + monitor my computer now >.>
Anyways, i JUST moved, and do online school, and trust me, there is no weed or people to chill with.
So what the fuck should i do in my 6 hours of spare time >.<

item.title: What to do >.<
item.dc:creator: @I_Pka_Kid_I I Pka Kid I
item.description:
@I_Pka_Kid_I wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:5, topic:421669”]I’m 16. Having monitored Internet can be annoying at times, but if you are truthful and have good reasons for some things (like my parents saw that NSFW thread on here earlier, I explained about moparscape and I didn’t get in trouble) it works out fine. It’s also helped me stay away from pornography[/quote]Oh god bro.
Goodie goodie two shoe

Read full topic

item.title: What to do >.<
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:37, topic:421669”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=524327.msg3816503#msg3816503 date=1321392520]Edit 1 - point?
Edit 2 - I didn’t have monitored internet when I was 10. They pay for my internet, electricity, and hardware. Is there a reason I shouldn’t do something this simple to keep them happy?
Edit 3 - Yea, probably. That and the fact it’s unprofessional and illegal for underaged people to view.
[/quote]
Edit 1: The first Edit was a reaction to this statement:

]I’m not sure the type of monitoring his parents use, but mine is straight from the computer itself. That means any outgoing connections are logged, and using a proxy doesn’t stop that from working. You can look up ‘covenant eyes’ if you’re curious

Where it seemed like you had trouble bypassing it.

Edit 2: If your parents had some respect towards their 16/17 year old son, they would give you your privacy. Have you gave them reason for not trusting you? I don’t think so, correct me if I’m wrong.

Edit 3: Since when is watching porn “unprofessional”? What profession are you referring to? I’m curious. Whether is legal or not in the USA does not matter because as mentioned here:

I have bypassed it to do things like torrent TV shows, because you never want that logged

You clearly passed the breaking the law phase. Apart from that, why wouldn’t you want that logged? I download movies for my dad all the time.

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=524327.msg3816408#msg3816408 date=1321388437]
It’s free for us from our church.
[/quote]This is probably the reason why your parents monitor you.

I’m not trying to offend you nor your lifestyle, I’m just giving my opinion.[/quote]I’ll skip to edit 2 because the first was just a reply -
Nope. Though to be honest I don’t really consider it to be that bad of a violation… like I said they don’t even look at the logs unless something bad pops up.

EDIT 3 - Professional meaning it looks very bad for ANY site to have a pornography section, because it is illegal. Just like we wouldn’t ever have a torrent section (and I wouldn’t support it either, even though I do torrent sometimes)

And I guess you could say that’s breaking the law, but to be honest my mom has even asked me to torrent shows for her before. We don’t torrent anything that costs money or a license though. I J-walk too.

Yea, my parents monitor me. You could say it’s because we go to church, or you could say it’s because they don’t want me watching porn. And to be honest, I’m ok with that.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do >.<
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:36, topic:421669”]Edit 1 - point?
Edit 2 - I didn’t have monitored internet when I was 10. They pay for my internet, electricity, and hardware. Is there a reason I shouldn’t do something this simple to keep them happy?
Edit 3 - Yea, probably. That and the fact it’s unprofessional and illegal for underaged people to view.[/quote]
Edit 1: The first Edit was a reaction to this statement:

Davidi2:

]I’m not sure the type of monitoring his parents use, but mine is straight from the computer itself. That means any outgoing connections are logged, and using a proxy doesn’t stop that from working. You can look up ‘covenant eyes’ if you’re curious

Where it seemed like you had trouble bypassing it.

Edit 2: If your parents had some respect towards their 16/17 year old son, they would give you your privacy. Have you gave them reason for not trusting you? I don’t think so, correct me if I’m wrong.

Edit 3: Since when is watching porn “unprofessional”? What profession are you referring to? I’m curious. Whether is legal or not in the USA does not matter because as mentioned here:

Davidi2:

I have bypassed it to do things like torrent TV shows, because you never want that logged

You clearly passed the breaking the law phase. Apart from that, why wouldn’t you want that logged? I download movies for my dad all the time.

[quote=“Davidi2, post:33, topic:421669”]It’s free for us from our church.[/quote]This is probably the reason why your parents monitor you.

I’m not trying to offend you nor your lifestyle, I’m just giving my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: What to do >.<
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

I could easily bypass it if I wanted to (and I have before), but what’s the point? I don’t need or want to watch pornography. And they’d probably wonder what was up if all of a sudden my logs started showing a lot less activity. I have bypassed it to do things like torrent TV shows, because you never want that logged

[quote=“MistaBigBoss, post:34, topic:421669”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=524327.msg3815789#msg3815789 date=1321321298]
I’m 16. Having monitored Internet can be annoying at times, but if you are truthful and have good reasons for some things (like my parents saw that NSFW thread on here earlier, I explained about moparscape and I didn’t get in trouble) it works out fine. It’s also helped me stay away from pornography

[/quote]How the fuck can your internet be monitored? Every average computer geek knows how to bypass these things…

EDIT: In that case, ever heard of ARP posioning?

ANOTHER EDIT: You should really tell your parents you’re not that 10 year old kid anymore.

ANOTHER EDIT EDIT: No wonder you’re not up for Mopar porno section.[/quote]Edit 1 - point?
Edit 2 - I didn’t have monitored internet when I was 10. They pay for my internet, electricity, and hardware. Is there a reason I shouldn’t do something this simple to keep them happy?
Edit 3 - Yea, probably. That and the fact it’s unprofessional and illegal for underaged people to view.

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:35, topic:421669”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=524327.msg3816408#msg3816408 date=1321388437]

Use proxies and incognito chrome windows I’m sure you’ll be fine doing whatever you need, including porn.
[size=1pt]p.s. can’t believe you don’t watch porn david, don’t know a single person who doesn’t haha, afraid to say it is pretty normal.[/size]

[/quote]I’m not sure the type of monitoring his parents use, but mine is straight from the computer itself. That means any outgoing connections are logged, and using a proxy doesn’t stop that from working. You can look up ‘covenant eyes’ if you’re curious

[size=1pt]p.s. - to be honest it doesn’t bother me, maybe i’m just used to it :P[/size]

Reinstall Windows/Linux distro.?

edit: or even install an OS on a separate partition and just boot into that when you prefer not to be watched on like a 5 year old, or desperate measures, just browse from a livecd, so many possibilities… ;D

ps. $9 a month just for a shitty privacy program?![/quote]… I live in my parents house, they’d probably notice if I reinstalled windows.

And like I said, they don’t really care what I do. It just gives them a sense of security. They don’t even look at the log unless some strange keyword pops up.

It’s free for us from our church.

Read full topic

[size=1pt]p.s. - to be honest it doesn’t bother me, maybe i’m just used to it :P[/size][/quote]
Reinstall Windows/Linux distro.?

edit: or even install an OS on a separate partition and just boot into that when you prefer not to be watched on like a 5 year old, or desperate measures, just browse from a livecd, so many possibilities… ;D

ps. $9 a month just for a shitty privacy program?!

Read full topic
